title: Python Basics
content: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability and simplicity.

title: Advanced Python
content: Advanced Python includes topics such as decorators, generators, context managers, and metaclasses.

title: MongoDB Overview
content: MongoDB is a NoSQL document-oriented database that stores data in JSON-like documents.

title: MongoDB Indexing
content: Indexes support the efficient execution of queries in MongoDB. Without indexes, MongoDB must scan every document.

title: What is FAISS?
content: FAISS is a library developed by Facebook AI to perform efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors.

title: FAISS Index Types
content: FAISS supports various index types like Flat, IVF, HNSW, and PQ for different speed-accuracy tradeoffs.

title: What is RAG?
content: Retrieval-Augmented Generation is an NLP framework that retrieves relevant documents to help generate more accurate answers.

title: LLM Basics
content: Large Language Models (LLMs) are deep learning models trained on massive text datasets to generate human-like text.

title: OpenAI GPT Models
content: GPT models by OpenAI are autoregressive transformers that generate coherent and contextually relevant text.

title: Transformers in NLP
content: Transformers use attention mechanisms to process sequences, making them ideal for NLP tasks.

title: Hugging Face
content: Hugging Face is a platform and library for sharing and using pre-trained models in NLP and other ML domains.

title: LangChain Framework
content: LangChain is a framework to build applications powered by LLMs with composable components like chains and agents.

title: Vector Databases
content: Vector databases store embeddings and enable similarity search, often used in AI applications like RAG and search.

title: Pinecone
content: Pinecone is a managed vector database for building scalable similarity search applications.

title: ChromaDB
content: Chroma is an open-source vector database used to store and retrieve document embeddings efficiently.

title: NLP Tokenization
content: Tokenization is the process of converting text into smaller units like words or subwords for NLP processing.

title: Text Embeddings
content: Embeddings are dense vector representations of text used for comparison and similarity search.

title: Retrieval Techniques
content: Common retrieval techniques include keyword search, TF-IDF, BM25, and vector similarity search.

title: Prompt Engineering
content: Prompt engineering is the art of crafting inputs to maximize the performance and relevance of LLM responses.

title: Chain of Thought Prompting
content: Chain of Thought prompting encourages step-by-step reasoning in LLMs, improving performance on complex tasks.
